snippet: If you want deep, explosive flavor without much work, look to the hot-weather regions of the world, where big flavor doesn’t require big effort.
abstract: Hot-weather regions of the world provide inspiration for recipes where big flavor doesn’t require big effort; grilling in summer, which gives food a distinctive element of smoky, charred taste, is enhanced by coating foods with spices used in most tropical cuisines; recipes for chicken wings, baby back ribs and lamb kebabs given.

byline.original: By JOHN WILLOUGHBY and CHRIS SCHLESINGER

lead_paragraph: If you want deep, explosive flavor without much work, look to the hot-weather regions of the world, where big flavor doesn’t require big effort.

headline.seo: In the Tropics, Cooking With Razzle-Dazzle
headline.main: Conjuring a Taste Filled With Tropical Wonder
headline.print_headline: For the Grill, Splashes of Tropical Taste
